member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE
member.summary: The TUNNEL_TYPE enumeration type defines the encapsulation method used by a tunnel, as described by the Internet Assigned Names Authority (IANA).

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_NONE
member.summary: Indicates that a tunnel is not specified.

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_OTHER
member.summary: Indicates that none of the following tunnel types is specified.

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_DIRECT
member.summary: Specifies that a packet is encapsulated directly within a normal IP header, with no intermediate header, and the packet is sent unicast to the remote tunnel endpoint.

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_6TO4
member.summary: Specifies that an IPv6 packet is encapsulated directly within an IPv4 header, with no intermediate header, and the packet is sent unicast to the destination determined by the 6to4 protocol.

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_ISATAP
member.summary: Specifies that an IPv6 packet is encapsulated directly within an IPv4 header, with no intermediate header, and the packet is sent unicast to the destination determined by the ISATAP protocol.

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_TEREDO
member.summary: Specifies that the tunnel uses Teredo encapsulation.

member.name: TUNNEL_TYPE.TUNNEL_TYPE_IPHTTPS
member.summary: Specifies that the tunnel uses IP over Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). This tunnel type is supported in Windows 7 and later versions of the Windows operating system.
